Description: Rim and body fragment of North Ionian or Aeolian meander rim pottery plate; beige slip. Maeander band on tip of rim; lotus frieze on outside of floor, one element preserved with added red on central petal of flower; black band with added red line on its inside. Outside, four bands of pale glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.64)
